SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To describe transient oromotor deficits in benign childhood epilepsy with centrotemporal spikes (BCECTS), an idiopathic age-specific epileptic syndrome with a benign course
METHODS: Five children with BCECTS and intermittent dysarthria and drooling not in the context of typical clinical seizures are presented
RESULTS: The periods of oromotor deficits correlated with increased seizure frequency in all children
Concomitant EEGs that were recorded during periods of dysarthria in four of the children revealed focal electrographic seizures
The reported children did not differ from other patients with BCECTS in any other respect
CONCLUSIONS: Transient oromotor dysfunction is a rare ictal phenomenon that occurs in children with BCECTS with no other unique clinical features
